In the dead of night, as a low mist hung about the curtain wall, you creep out a postern door and float across the moat on an inflated sheepskin.  It's only by the ineptitude of the enemy watch that you stagger, dripping wet, through the siege lines and to the safety of a nearby wood.  Thanks be to God! ... Although any family left behind is likely angry with us...

Your steward leads you down into the store rooms to a passage you didn't even know existed.  Beyond it, a dismal tunnel full of death and decay, and you are only too glad to reach the moat and relatively fresh water. I hope I never have to do that again!  It only now occurs to me that any family left behind is likely angry with me for leaving them in the hands of the enemy.

They said only a lunatic would attempt climbing down the south-east wall, and certainly the enemy agreed!  A near thing, too, when my foot slipped on that patch of moss.  My brush with death over with, and safety assured, it only now occurs to me that any family left behind will see this as a desertion, not a bold deed of heroism...
